article_text: - WAffiltNOTON (AP>-8alvage crews hoisted the tail of an Air Florida jetBner fnra the frigid grime of the Potonoac River on Monday, but the achievement turned sour when the crumpled section failed to yield two flight recorders which could unravel the causes of last week’s crash. Investigators were initially extdtant when, after battling the frozen river for five days, divers managed to tie straps under the Boeing 737's tail and lift it ^m a crane on the bridge overhead. As the 15-foot section was pulled up, it broke away from parts of the jetliner’s fuselage. An Associated Press photographer said he saw one body drop back to the water, as did much d^nla.
